author: bridge-bot
content: <glamperd> My test site is here: https://trustedsetuptest.web.app/

author: bridge-bot
content: <glamperd> The requirement for nonce>=3 is commented out in this version. Use any old ETH account.

author: bridge-bot
content: <glamperd> The computation will use multiple web workers. Looks like it fails in some browsers (e.g. Mozilla) It works in Chrome.

author: .vbuterin
content: could we add more crypto-native options for "participate using"?

author: .vbuterin
content: Like say, sign in with ethereum if you have >=1 ETH or a PoH or a POAP

author: .vbuterin
content: (if we need some kind of anti-sybil)

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> yeah, this is very much the plan! currently we're focusing on getting the crypto side of things up, running, and stable.

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> Yeah, and I'd even say that for the "real" ceremony, ETH-native login should be the default, and GH should act as a backup only. Probably want >1 backup too, with Twitter a likely easy integration? Not sure if there's a China/Russia auth-able app we should also link?

author: bridge-bot
content: <vbuterin> Github is the one that's easily accessible everywhere
